ground_truth: TEX takes the list, examines it, then folds it and puts it in his pocket. They finish with the items from the bag. She hangs up and turns to JEAN-LOUIS. REGGIE looks to where JEAN-LOUIS is pointing -- to the top of the high armoire. Taking one of the straight chairs to the armoire, she stands on it. Although she is still not high enough to see anything, by standing on tip-toes she is able to reach with her hand over the top and grope around blindly. REGGIE has finally managed to pull down the case -- a rectangular black bag about the size and shape of a trombone case. As he climbs off the chair, JEAN-LOUIS suddenly runs to the door, unbolts it and runs into the hall, CAMERA PANNING with him. As JEAN-LOUIS runs out into the hall, shouting, DYLE is the first one to appear, coming out of GIDEON's room. TEX has also appeared from REGGIE's room, followed by GIDEON. The THREE MEN rush by JEAN-LOUIS and squeeze simultaneously into SCOBIE's room. As DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON enter, REGGIE is placing the little straight black chair to its original position. As they stare at the case, surprised and just a little embarrassed, slowly TEX lowers the lid. The MEN avoid looking at one another, including REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS by the door. The MEN look at one another. The THREE MEN hurry past REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS and out of the door. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON, followed by REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS cross the hall to DYLE's room. DYLE turns the key which is still in the door. He enters, followed by the others. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stand in the center of the room, looking around. REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS wait in the open doorway. The room looks like a cyclone hit the place, but there is no sign of SCOBIE. The sound of running water can be heard coming from behind the closed door to the bathroom and DYLE is the first to notice the water beginning to leak out from under the door. SCOBIE, still dressed in his raincoat, lies face up, his head submerged in the filled tub, the water now pouring over the edge. His face is distorted. DYLE's hand appears and turns off the water. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON staring at CAMERA. CLOSE SHOT -- SCOBIE. CAMERA WHIRLS for a TIGHT CLOSE SHOT of a MAID, her eyes widening as the realization that the man is dead strikes her. Then she screams. CLOSE SHOT -- GRANDPIERRE. GRANDPIERRE raps for silence on his desk. During the pause, he looks into each face in turn. REGGIE and DYLE walking along the quai, next to the Seine. They have passed an ice-cream wagon on the corner of the Pont au Double.

test_cases.description: TEX takes the roster, inspects it, then folds it and places it in his pocket. They complete with the objects from the sack. She hangs up and turns to JEAN-LOUIS. REGGIE glances to where JEAN-LOUIS is indicating -- to the top of the tall wardrobe. Taking one of the straight seats to the wardrobe, she stands on it. Although she is still not tall enough to see anything, by standing on tip-toes she is able to extend with her hand over the top and fumble around blindly. REGGIE has finally succeeded to pull down the container -- a rectangular black case about the size and shape of a trombone container. As he descends off the seat, JEAN-LOUIS suddenly dashes to the entryway, unlatches it and races into the corridor, CAMERA PANNING with him. As JEAN-LOUIS dashes out into the corridor, yelling, DYLE is the first one to emerge, coming out of GIDEON's room. TEX has also emerged from REGGIE's room, followed by GIDEON. The THREE MEN hurry by JEAN-LOUIS and wedge simultaneously into SCOBIE's room. As DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON enter, REGGIE is placing the small straight black seat to its original position. As they gaze at the container, astonished and just a little embarrassed, slowly TEX lowers the cover. The MEN avoid glancing at one another, including REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS by the entryway. The MEN glance at one another. The THREE MEN rush past REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS and out of the entryway. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON, followed by REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS cross the corridor to DYLE's room. DYLE turns the key which is still in the entryway. He enters, followed by the others. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stand in the center of the room, gazing around. REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS wait in the open doorway. The room seems like a cyclone struck the area, but there is no indication of SCOBIE. The noise of flowing water can be heard coming from behind the shut entryway to the bathroom and DYLE is the first to observe the water beginning to seep out from under the entryway. SCOBIE, still clothed in his raincoat, lies face up, his head submerged in the filled tub, the water now spilling over the rim. His face is contorted. DYLE's hand appears and turns off the water. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON staring at CAMERA. CLOSE SHOT -- SCOBIE. CAMERA WHIRLS for a TIGHT CLOSE SHOT of a MAID, her eyes widening as the realization that the man is deceased strikes her. Then she shrieks. CLOSE SHOT -- GRANDPIERRE. GRANDPIERRE taps for silence on his desk. During the pause, he gazes into each face in turn. REGGIE and DYLE strolling along the quai, next to the Seine. They have passed an ice-cream cart on the corner of the Pont au Double.

REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS wait in the open doorway. Like a cyclone hit the place, the room looks, but SCOBIE is not seen. The sound of running water is noticed coming from behind the closed door to the bathroom, and the water beginning to leak out from under the door is first noticed by DYLE. Still dressed in his raincoat, SCOBIE lies face up, his head submerged in the filled tub, water now pouring over the edge. Distorted is his face. The water is turned off by DYLE's hand appearing. Then, a scream is let out by her. GRANDPIERRE is shown in CLOSE SHOT. Silence is rapped for by GRANDPIERRE on his desk. During the pause, each face is looked into in turn by him. REGGIE and DYLE are walking along the quai, next to the Seine. An ice-cream wagon on the corner of the Pont au Double is passed by them.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: TEX examines the list, folds it, and pockets it. They finish with the bag's items. She hangs up and turns to JEAN-LOUIS. REGGIE looks where JEAN-LOUIS points—atop the high armoire. Using a chair, she stands on tip-toes to reach and blindly grope over the top. REGGIE pulls down a rectangular black case resembling a trombone case. As she descends, JEAN-LOUIS bolts to the door, unbolts it, and runs into the hall, CAMERA PANNING with him. DYLE emerges from GIDEON's room, followed by TEX from REGGIE's room and GIDEON. The THREE MEN rush past JEAN-LOUIS into SCOBIE's room. As they enter, REGGIE returns the chair to its place. Surprised and slightly embarrassed, TEX lowers the case lid. The MEN avoid eye contact, including REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS by the door. The THREE MEN hurry past REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS to DYLE's room. DYLE turns the key in the door and enters with the others. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stand in the room's center, surveying the cyclone-like mess, but SCOBIE is absent. Water runs from the closed bathroom door, and DYLE notices it first. SCOBIE, in his raincoat, lies face-up in the overflowing tub, his face distorted. DYLE turns off the water. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stare at CAMERA. CLOSE SHOT—SCOBIE. CAMERA WHIRLS to a TIGHT CLOSE SHOT of a MAID, her eyes widening as she realizes the man is dead, then she screams. CLOSE SHOT—GRANDPIERRE. GRANDPIERRE raps for silence on his desk, pausing to look at each face. REGGIE and DYLE walk along the quai by the Seine, passing an ice-cream wagon at the Pont au Double corner.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: TEX examines the list, folds it, and pockets it. They finish with the bag's items. She hangs up and turns to JEAN-LOUIS. REGGIE looks where JEAN-LOUIS points—atop the armoire. Using a chair, she stands on tip-toes to reach and grope blindly. REGGIE pulls down a rectangular black case. As he descends, JEAN-LOUIS bolts to the door, unbolts it, and runs into the hall, CAMERA PANNING. DYLE emerges from GIDEON's room, followed by TEX and GIDEON from REGGIE's room. The THREE MEN rush past JEAN-LOUIS into SCOBIE's room. REGGIE returns the chair to its place. Surprised and embarrassed, TEX lowers the case lid. The MEN avoid eye contact, then hurry past REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS to DYLE's room. DYLE locks the door behind them. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stand in the room's center, while REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS wait at the door. The room is chaotic, with no sign of SCOBIE. Water leaks from the bathroom, and DYLE notices it first. SCOBIE, in a raincoat, lies face-up in the overflowing tub. DYLE turns off the water. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stare at CAMERA. CLOSE SHOT—SCOBIE. CAMERA WHIRLS to a MAID, who realizes the man is dead and screams. CLOSE SHOT—GRANDPIERRE, who raps for silence and looks at each face. REGGIE and DYLE walk along the quai by the Seine, passing an ice-cream wagon near Pont au Double.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: TEX carefully takes the list in his hands, scrutinizing it with a focused gaze. After examining it thoroughly, he folds the paper neatly and tucks it securely into his pocket. They proceed to finish dealing with the items that were taken out from the bag. She ends her phone call and turns her attention to JEAN-LOUIS. REGGIE shifts her gaze to follow where JEAN-LOUIS is pointing, which is towards the top of the tall, imposing armoire. She takes one of the straight-backed chairs and places it in front of the armoire, climbing onto it with determination. Despite this effort, she finds herself still not quite high enough to see anything clearly. However, by balancing on her tip-toes, she manages to extend her hand over the top, groping around blindly in search of something. REGGIE finally succeeds in pulling down the case, which is a rectangular black bag, reminiscent in size and shape to that of a trombone case. As he carefully steps down from the chair, JEAN-LOUIS suddenly dashes to the door, quickly unbolting it and sprinting into the hallway, with the CAMERA PANNING to follow his movement. As JEAN-LOUIS bursts into the hall, shouting loudly, DYLE is the first to emerge, stepping out from GIDEON's room. TEX also appears, coming from REGGIE's room, with GIDEON following closely behind. The THREE MEN rush past JEAN-LOUIS, squeezing simultaneously into SCOBIE's room. As DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON make their entrance, REGGIE is busy returning the small, straight black chair to its original position. The men stare at the case, their expressions a mix of surprise and slight embarrassment, as TEX slowly lowers the lid. The MEN avoid making eye contact with one another, including REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS, who stand by the door. The MEN exchange glances. The THREE MEN hurry past REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS, exiting through the door. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON, with REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS following, cross the hall to DYLE's room. DYLE turns the key, which is still in the lock of the door, and enters, with the others trailing behind him. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stand in the center of the room, surveying their surroundings. REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS wait in the open doorway. The room appears as if a cyclone has swept through, leaving chaos in its wake, but there is no sign of SCOBIE. The sound of running water is audible, emanating from behind the closed bathroom door, and DYLE is the first to notice water beginning to seep out from under the door. SCOBIE, still clad in his raincoat, lies face up, his head submerged in the filled bathtub, with water now cascading over the edge. His face is distorted. DYLE's hand reaches out and turns off the water. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stare intently at the CAMERA. CLOSE SHOT -- SCOBIE. The CAMERA WHIRLS for a TIGHT CLOSE SHOT of a MAID, her eyes widening in horror as she realizes the man is dead. She then lets out a piercing scream. CLOSE SHOT -- GRANDPIERRE. GRANDPIERRE raps for silence on his desk. During the ensuing pause, he looks into each face in turn. REGGIE and DYLE are seen walking along the quai, next to the Seine. They have just passed an ice-cream wagon stationed at the corner of the Pont au Double.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: TEX holds the list with an air of meticulous care, his fingers carefully clasping the paper as he scrutinizes every detail with an intensely focused gaze. After he has examined the contents thoroughly and to his satisfaction, he folds the paper with precision, tucking it securely into his pocket for safekeeping. They then proceed to meticulously deal with the various items that have been extracted from the bag. She brings her phone call to a conclusion and diverts her full attention toward JEAN-LOUIS. REGGIE allows her gaze to follow the direction indicated by JEAN-LOUIS's outstretched finger, pointing emphatically toward the top of the tall, imposing armoire, which stands like a sentinel in the room. She takes one of the straight-backed chairs, positioning it firmly in front of the armoire, and climbs onto it with a determined resolve. Despite this earnest effort, she finds herself still not quite high enough to see anything clearly perched atop the armoire. However, by balancing precariously on her tip-toes, she manages to extend her hand over the top, groping around blindly in a search for something elusive. At last, REGGIE succeeds in pulling down the case, which reveals itself to be a rectangular black bag, reminiscent in both size and shape to that of a trombone case. As she carefully steps down from the chair, JEAN-LOUIS suddenly makes a dash to the door, his movements swift and agile, as he quickly unbolts it and sprints into the hallway, the CAMERA PANNING to capture his every movement. As JEAN-LOUIS bursts into the hall, shouting loudly with urgency, DYLE is the first to respond, emerging from GIDEON's room with a sense of purpose. TEX also appears, stepping out from REGGIE's room, with GIDEON trailing closely behind. The THREE MEN rush past JEAN-LOUIS, squeezing simultaneously through the entrance into SCOBIE's room. As DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON make their hurried entrance, REGGIE is occupied with returning the small, straight-backed black chair to its original position in the room. The men cast their eyes upon the case, their expressions a blend of surprise and slight embarrassment, as TEX slowly and deliberately lowers the lid. The MEN avoid making eye contact with one another, including REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS, who remain standing silently by the door. The MEN exchange fleeting glances. The THREE MEN hurry past REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS once more, exiting swiftly through the door. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON, with REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS following behind, traverse the hall toward DYLE's room. DYLE turns the key, which remains in the lock of the door, and enters, with the others trailing closely behind him. Inside, DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stand at the center of the room, their eyes scanning the chaotic surroundings as if a cyclone had recently swept through, although there is no sign of SCOBIE. The sound of running water becomes audible, emanating from behind the closed bathroom door, and DYLE is the first to notice the water beginning to seep ominously out from beneath the door. Inside, SCOBIE, still clad in his raincoat, is lying face up, his head submerged in the filled bathtub, with water now cascading over the edge. His face is grotesquely distorted. DYLE's hand reaches out instinctively to turn off the water. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON fix their gaze intently on the CAMERA. CLOSE SHOT -- SCOBIE. The CAMERA WHIRLS for a TIGHT CLOSE SHOT of a MAID, her eyes widening in absolute horror as she comprehends that the man is indeed dead. She then lets out a piercing scream that echoes throughout the hallway. CLOSE SHOT -- GRANDPIERRE. GRANDPIERRE raps his knuckles for silence on his desk. During the ensuing pause, he takes a moment to look into each face in turn. REGGIE and DYLE are subsequently seen walking along the quai, next to the serene Seine River. They have just passed an ice-cream wagon that is stationed at the corner of the historic Pont au Double.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: TEX takes the list in his hands, carefully examining each detail on the paper with a focused gaze. Once satisfied, he methodically folds the list into a neat square and slips it securely into his pocket. Meanwhile, they complete their task with the items from the bag, ensuring everything is accounted for. She finishes her phone call, gently placing the receiver back before turning her attention to JEAN-LOUIS. REGGIE follows JEAN-LOUIS's pointed direction, her eyes tracing the line to the top of the high armoire. Determined, she retrieves one of the straight chairs, positioning it firmly against the armoire. Climbing onto the chair, she stands tall, yet finds herself still too short to see over the top. Undeterred, she rises onto her tip-toes, stretching her arm upward to blindly feel around the surface. Her fingers finally make contact with the object, and she manages to pull down the case—a rectangular black bag reminiscent of a trombone case. As she carefully descends from the chair, JEAN-LOUIS suddenly dashes to the door, swiftly unbolting it and sprinting into the hall, with the CAMERA smoothly panning to follow his movement. As JEAN-LOUIS bursts into the hall, his voice echoes with shouts, drawing attention. DYLE is the first to respond, emerging quickly from GIDEON's room. Simultaneously, TEX appears from REGGIE's room, with GIDEON close behind. The THREE MEN rush past JEAN-LOUIS, their urgency palpable as they squeeze together into SCOBIE's room. Inside, as DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON enter, REGGIE calmly returns the little straight black chair to its original position. The MEN's eyes fixate on the case, their expressions a mix of surprise and slight embarrassment, prompting TEX to slowly lower the lid. An awkward silence hangs in the air as the MEN avoid eye contact with one another, as well as with REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS by the door. After a moment, the THREE MEN hastily move past REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS, exiting the room. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON, with REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS following, cross the hall to DYLE's room. DYLE turns the key still lodged in the door, opening it and stepping inside, with the others trailing behind. Once inside, DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stand in the center, their eyes scanning the room, which appears as if a cyclone has torn through, yet there is no trace of SCOBIE. The sound of running water draws their attention to the closed bathroom door, where DYLE is the first to notice water seeping out from underneath. Inside, SCOBIE, still clad in his raincoat, lies face up in the filled tub, his head submerged, with water cascading over the edge, distorting his features. DYLE's hand reaches in to turn off the water, halting the overflow. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stare intently at the CAMERA. In a CLOSE SHOT, SCOBIE's lifeless form is captured, and the CAMERA swiftly shifts to a TIGHT CLOSE SHOT of a MAID, her eyes widening in horror as she comprehends the man's death, leading her to let out a piercing scream. In a CLOSE SHOT, GRANDPIERRE raps his desk for silence, commanding attention. During the ensuing pause, he scrutinizes each face in the room, his gaze lingering on each person in turn. Later, REGGIE and DYLE are seen walking along the quai beside the Seine, their pace leisurely as they pass an ice-cream wagon stationed at the corner of the Pont au Double.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: TEX examines the list, folds it, and pockets it. After finishing with the bag's items, she hangs up and turns to JEAN-LOUIS. REGGIE uses a chair to reach the top of a high armoire, managing to pull down a rectangular black case. As she descends, JEAN-LOUIS runs to the door, unbolts it, and rushes into the hall, with the camera following him. DYLE emerges from GIDEON's room, while TEX and GIDEON appear from REGGIE's room, and all three men hurry into SCOBIE's room. REGGIE returns the chair to its place as the men, surprised and slightly embarrassed, lower the case lid. Avoiding eye contact, they quickly exit past REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS and head to DYLE's room. DYLE unlocks the door, and they enter, with REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS waiting at the doorway. The room is in disarray, with no sign of SCOBIE. Hearing running water, DYLE notices it leaking from the bathroom door. Inside, SCOBIE lies in the tub, water overflowing. DYLE turns off the water as they all stare at the scene. The camera shifts to a maid, who realizes SCOBIE is dead and screams. GRANDPIERRE calls for silence, scrutinizing each face. Later, REGGIE and DYLE walk along the quai by the Seine, passing an ice-cream wagon near the Pont au Double.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: TEX takes the list, a collection of instructions assumed to be for the heist they are planning, examines it, then folds it and puts it in his pocket. They finish with the items from the bag, which include unusual antiques that might be linked to a recent theft in the area. She hangs up and turns to JEAN-LOUIS, a boy known for his curious nature and quick reflexes. REGGIE looks to where JEAN-LOUIS is pointing -- to the top of the high armoire, an imposing piece of furniture crafted in the 18th century. Taking one of the straight chairs, known as a Louis XVI style, to the armoire, she stands on it. Although she is still not high enough to see anything, by standing on tip-toes she is able to reach with her hand over the top and grope around blindly. REGGIE has finally managed to pull down the case -- a rectangular black bag about the size and shape of a trombone case, which often holds valuable or secretive contents. As he climbs off the chair, JEAN-LOUIS suddenly runs to the door, unbolts it with the swiftness of mischief, and runs into the hall, CAMERA PANNING with him. As JEAN-LOUIS runs out into the hall, shouting, DYLE is the first one to appear, coming out of GIDEON's room, which was thought to contain a safe full of documents. TEX has also appeared from REGGIE's room, followed by GIDEON, who is known for his strategic mind. The THREE MEN rush by JEAN-LOUIS and squeeze simultaneously into SCOBIE's room, an additional suite they rented yesterday. As DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON enter, REGGIE is placing the little straight black chair to its original position. As they stare at the case, surprised and just a little embarrassed, slowly TEX lowers the lid. The MEN avoid looking at one another, including REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS by the door, feeling the tension in the air. The MEN look at one another. The THREE MEN hurry past REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS and out of the door. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON, followed by REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS cross the hall to DYLE's room, which serves as their temporary office. DYLE turns the key, which is still in the door, an old-fashioned brass key typical of Parisian hotels. He enters, followed by the others. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON stand in the center of the room, looking around. REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS wait in the open doorway. The room looks like a cyclone hit the place, with papers and books scattered, but there is no sign of SCOBIE, known for his unpredictable nature. The sound of running water can be heard coming from behind the closed door to the bathroom and DYLE is the first to notice the water beginning to leak out from under the door, indicating a critical situation. SCOBIE, still dressed in his raincoat, lies face up, his head submerged in the filled tub, the water now pouring over the edge. His face is distorted. DYLE's hand appears and turns off the water. DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON staring at CAMERA. CLOSE SHOT -- SCOBIE. CAMERA WHIRLS for a TIGHT CLOSE SHOT of a MAID, her eyes widening as the realization that the man is dead strikes her, representing the abrupt transition from routine to chaos. Then she screams. CLOSE SHOT -- GRANDPIERRE, a renowned detective known for his piercing gaze. GRANDPIERRE raps for silence on his desk, which is cluttered with case files. During the pause, he looks into each face in turn. REGGIE and DYLE walking along the quai, next to the Seine, the iconic river that flows through the heart of Paris. They have passed an ice-cream wagon on the corner of the Pont au Double, a popular spot for both locals and tourists to enjoy a treat.

REGGIE looks to where JEANLOUIS is pointing  to the top of the high armoire. Taking one of the straight chairs to the armoire she stands on it. DYLE is the first one to appear coming out of GIDEON's room. TEX has also appeared from REGGIE's room followed by GIDEON. The THREE MEN rush by JEANLOUIS and squeeze simultaneously into SCOBIE's room. As DYLE TEX and GIDEON enter REGGIE is placing the little straight black chair to its original position. As they stare at the case surprised and just a little embarrassed. slowly TEX lowers the lid. The MEN avoid looking at one another including REGGIE and JEANLOUIS by the door. The MEN look at one another. The THREE MEN hurry past REGGIE and JEANLOUIS and out of the door. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. DYLE TEX and GIDEON followed by REGGIE and JEANLOUIS cross the hall to DYLE's room. DYLE turns the key which is still in the door. He enters followed by the others. DYLE TEX and GIDEON stand in the center of the room looking around. REGGIE and JEANLOUIS wait in the open doorway. The room looks like a cyclone hit the place but there is no sign of SCOBIE. The sound of running water can be heard coming from behind the closed door to the bathroom and DYLE is the first to notice the water beginning to leak out from under the door. SCOBIE still dressed in his raincoat lies face up his head submerged in the filled tub. the water now pouring over the edge. His face is distorted. DYLE's hand appears and turns off the water. DYLE TEX and GIDEON staring at CAMERA. CLOSE SHOT. SCOBIE. CAMERA WHIRLS for a TIGHT CLOSE SHOT of a MAID her eyes widening as the realization that the man is dead strikes her. Then she screams CLOSE SHOT. GRANDPIERRE. GRANDPIERRE raps for silence on his desk. During the pause he looks into each face in turn. REGGIE and DYLE walking along the quai next to the Seine. They have passed an icecream wagon on the corner of the Pont au Double.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: TEX takes the list examines it then folds it and puts it in his pocket. They finish with the items from the bag. She hangs up and turns to JEANLOUIS. REGGIE looks to where JEANLOUIS is pointing  to the top of the high armoire. Taking one of the straight chairs to the armoire she stands on it. Although she is still not high enough to see anything by standing on tiptoes she is able to reach with her hand over the top and grope around blindly. REGGIE has finally managed to pull down the case. a rectangular black bag about the size and shape of a trombone case. As he climbs off the chair JEANLOUIS suddenly runs to the door unbolts it and runs into the hall. CAMERA PANNING with him. As JEANLOUIS runs out into the hall shouting. DYLE is the first one to appear coming out of GIDEON's room. TEX has also appeared from REGGIE's room followed by GIDEON. The THREE MEN rush by JEANLOUIS and squeeze simultaneously into SCOBIE's room. As DYLE TEX and GIDEON enter REGGIE is placing the little straight black chair to its original position. As they stare at the case surprised and just a little embarrassed. slowly TEX lowers the lid. The MEN avoid looking at one another including REGGIE and JEANLOUIS by the door. The MEN look at one another. The THREE MEN hurry past REGGIE and JEANLOUIS and out of the door. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: FLUFFY acquires the blueprint, surveys it, then crumples it and stuffs it in her hat. They conclude with the relics from the suitcase. He plugs in and pivots to LUCY. CHARLIE gazes to where LUCY is gesturing -- towards the peak of the tall bookshelf. Grabbing one of the low stools to the bookshelf, he climbs atop it. Although he is still not high enough to glimpse anything, by balancing on his heels he can stretch with his paw over the peak and fumble erratically. CHARLIE eventually succeeds in tugging down the trunk -- an oval brown box approximately the size and contour of a flute case. As he dismounts the stool, LUCY abruptly dashes to the window, unlatches it and dashes into the corridor, CAMERA SWEEPING with her. As LUCY darts into the corridor, whispering, OTTO is the first one to emerge, slipping out of VICTOR's chamber. FLUFFY has also emerged from CHARLIE's chamber, shadowed by VICTOR. The FIVE FIGURES jostle past LUCY and squeeze in unison into GORDON's chamber. As OTTO, FLUFFY, and VICTOR step in, CHARLIE is rearranging the tiny low white stool to its former location. As they regard the trunk, startled and slightly mortified, gradually FLUFFY closes the lid. The FIGURES steer clear of glancing at one another, including CHARLIE and LUCY by the window. The FIGURES glance at one another. The FIVE FIGURES rush past CHARLIE and LUCY and out through the window. OTTO, FLUFFY, and VICTOR, followed by CHARLIE and LUCY traipse across the corridor to OTTO's chamber. OTTO twists the button which remains in the window. He steps inside, trailed by the rest. OTTO, FLUFFY, and VICTOR stand in the middle of the chamber, inspecting around. CHARLIE and LUCY linger in the ajar opening. The chamber appears as though a hurricane struck, but there is no trace of GORDON. The sound of gentle whistling can be detected emanating from behind the sealed portal to the cloakroom and OTTO is the first to observe the breeze commencing to gush out from beneath the portal. GORDON, still clad in his poncho, reclines face down, his elbows submerged in the brimming basin, the breeze now blowing across the verge. His figure is distorted. OTTO's paw emerges and halts the breeze. OTTO, FLUFFY, and VICTOR gazing at CAMERA. CLOSE SHOT -- GORDON. CAMERA SPINS for a TIGHT CLOSE SHOT of a BUTLER, his eyebrows widening as the understanding that the gentleman is asleep strikes him. Then he gasps. CLOSE SHOT -- GERALDINE. GERALDINE taps for quiet on her book. During the lull, she peers into each countenance in succession. CHARLIE and OTTO strolling along the lane, adjacent to the canal. They have passed a popcorn stand on the junction of the Bridge of Joy.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: TEX examines the list, pockets it, and they finish unloading the bag. REGGIE stands on a chair to retrieve a black trombone-sized case from atop an armoire. Suddenly, JEAN-LOUIS bolts to the door and into the hall, where DYLE emerges from GIDEON's room, joined by TEX from REGGIE's room. The three men rush into SCOBIE's room, surprised and slightly embarrassed by what they find, while REGGIE returns the chair to its place. They all cross the hall to DYLE's room, which is in disarray but shows no sign of SCOBIE. Hearing water running, they notice it leaking from the bathroom. SCOBIE, in his raincoat, is found drowned in the tub, water spilling over. DYLE turns off the water. A maid sees the body and screams. GRANDPIERRE, seeking silence, scrutinizes each face across his desk. Meanwhile, REGGIE and DYLE walk along the quai by the Seine, passing an ice-cream wagon.
